intro: Hemitelia muricata, commonly known as the rough hemitelia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of mostly tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a lanceolate shape with serrated edges. Hemitelia muricata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
